org.rsna.ctp.stdstages.anonymizer

Class AnonymizerFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.rsna.ctp.stdstages.anonymizer.AnonymizerFunctions

  • public class AnonymizerFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
    MIRC anonymizer functions. These static methods provide the data modification functions used by the MIRC anonymizers. See the MIRC wiki for more more information.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • lookup

        public static java.lang.String lookup(java.util.Properties table,
                      java.lang.String keyType,
                      java.lang.String key)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Look up a String in a local unencrypted Properties object. The Properties table keys must be of the form keyType/key.
        Parameters:
        table - the lookup table
        keyType - any name relating keys of a particular category, for example "ptid".
        key - the value of the keyType to be looked up in the table.
        Returns:
        the value in the table corresponding to keyType/key.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the requested value cannot be found in the table.

      • integer

        public static java.lang.String integer(IntegerTable table,
                       java.lang.String keyType,
                       java.lang.String text,
                       int width)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Generate a replacement string for a text string using an IntegerTable. The replacement string is an integer numerical string. Replacement strings are based on the keyType, so text strings of different keyTypes are handled independently.
        Parameters:
        table - the IntegerTable to be used in assigining replacement strings.
        keyType - any name relating text strings of a particular category, for example "ptid".
        text - the value for which a replacement string is to be created.
        width - the minimum width of the replacement string.
        Returns:
        the replacement string for keyType/text.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the replacement string cannot be created.

      • initials

        public static java.lang.String initials(java.lang.String name)
        Generate the initials of a patient from the contents of a string formatted as "last^first^middle".
        Parameters:
        name - the name in the format of a DICOM PatientName element.
        Returns:
        the patient's initials in upper case (e.g., FML), or "X" if the name is null or empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the requested value cannot be found in the table.

      • hashName

        public static java.lang.String hashName(java.lang.String string,
                        int length,
                        int wordCount)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Generate a numeric replacement for a patient name from the contents string formatted as "last^first^middle".
        Parameters:
        string - the name to hash.
        length - the number of characters (maximum) in the output string.
        wordCount - the number of words to include in the hash. This can be used to exclude, for example, the middle name or initial.
        Returns:
        a numeric string consisting of length characters, the result of hashing the first wordCount words of the string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • round

        public static java.lang.String round(java.lang.String ageString,
                     int width)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Round an age field into groups of a specified size.
        Parameters:
        ageString - the age string to round.
        width - the width of each bin
        Returns:
        the age rounded to bins of size width, where the first bin is centered on zero. If the input string ends with alphabetic characters, they are appended to the result. Thus, if the function call is ("27y",5), the result String is 25y. If the length of the result string (with suffix characters) is odd, a leading "0" is prepended.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the age does not parse.

      • hashPtID

        public static java.lang.String hashPtID(java.lang.String siteid,
                        java.lang.String ptid)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Re-identify a patient by hashing the combination of a site ID and a patient ID for the site.
        Parameters:
        siteid - the ID of the site which generated the ptid.
        ptid - the ID of the patient.
        Returns:
        the MD5 hash of the combination of the siteid and ptid.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the hash fails.

      • hashPtID

        public static java.lang.String hashPtID(java.lang.String siteid,
                        java.lang.String ptid,
                        int maxlen)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Re-identify a patient by hashing the combination of a site ID and a patient ID for the site.
        Parameters:
        siteid - the ID of the site which generated the ptid.
        ptid - the ID of the patient.
        maxlen - the maximum number of characters to return.
        Returns:
        the MD5 hash of the combination of the siteid and ptid as a numeric string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the hash fails.

      • encrypt

        public static java.lang.String encrypt(java.lang.String string,
                       int offset)
        Encrypt a string using a Caesar cipher with a specified offset. This method offsets characters within their group (lower case, upper case, numeric). All other characters are not modified.
        Parameters:
        string - the string to encrypt.
        offset - the offset (positive for alphabetic order, negative for reverse alphabetic order.

      • incrementDate

        public static java.lang.String incrementDate(java.lang.String date,
                             long increment)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Add a constant to a date string.
        Parameters:
        date - the date in DICOM format.
        increment - the number of days to increment the date. Positive increments make the date later; negative increments make it earlier.
        Returns:
        the incremented date string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the date is in an illegal format.

      • modifyDate

        public static java.lang.String modifyDate(java.lang.String date,
                          int y,
                          int m,
                          int d)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Modify fields in a date string.
        Parameters:
        date - the date in DICOM format.
        y - the value to which to reset the year field (-1 means to leave it alone).
        m - the value to which to reset the month field (-1 means to leave it alone).
        d - the value to which to reset the day field (-1 means to leave it alone).
        Returns:
        the modified date string.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the date is in an illegal format.

        Returns:

        java.lang.Exception - if the hash fails.
